intro: Calochortus amoenus, commonly known as the showy glory-of-the-snow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which is part of the family Liliaceae, though it is now classified under the family Melanthiaceae. The plant features showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink, with a prominent central stigma. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Calochortus amoenus is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
